medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Abdominal pain is constant and unremitting, similar in severity to previous experiences with peptic ulcer disease. The patient has not had an appetite recently due to the pain and reports four episodes of nausea and vomiting. Pain is somewhat relieved by leaning forward and worsens when leaning back. There has been some recent constipation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Rheumatoid arthritis, Systemic lupus erythematosus, COPD, Gastroesophageal reflux disease, Hypothyroidism, Chronic anemia, previous left elbow surgery including antibiotic spacer placement, and history of atypical chest pain.
medical_history.family_history: Her mother died of myocardial infarction and father of complications of diabetes.
